articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Washington Post said Ukraine and Russia were set to send delegations to Qatar to negotiate a landmark agreement halting strikes on energy and power infrastructure.
articles.title: Russia denies report about indirect talks with Ukraine

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli strikes killed 19 people in Gaza on Sunday, including six children, Palestinian health authorities said, ahead of a visit to the region by U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken to try to push forward ceasefire talks.
articles.title: Blinken to push for Gaza ceasefire; Israel launches fresh strikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel is conducting a "robust investigation" of suspects accused of sexually abusing a Palestinian prisoner and is committed to upholding international legal standards regarding the treatment of detainees, the foreign affairs ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel says investigation underway in Palestinian prisoner abuse case

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhury, Jatindra Dash
articles.description: Junior doctors in many Indian hospitals remained off the job on Sunday demanding swift justice for a colleague who was raped and murdered, despite the end of a 24-hour strike called by the country's biggest association of doctors.
articles.title: India doctors end one strike over colleague's rape and murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sudan's government said it will send a delegation to Cairo for discussions with U.S. and Egyptian officials on Monday, keeping open the question of participation in peace talks aimed at ending a 16-month war.
articles.title: Sudan sending delegation to Cairo to meet U.S. and Egyptian mediators

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched on Sunday its third ballistic missile on Kyiv in August, with preliminary data showing that all the air weapons were destroyed on their approach to the city, the military administration of the Ukrainian capital said.
articles.title: Russia launches third ballistic missile attack on Kyiv this month, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four years after the military ousted Mali’s then-president and came to power, many residents say economic troubles are worsening and constant power cuts are hurting businesses.
articles.title: Malians suffer economic hardship after four years of military rule

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Heavy rains lashed Alpine regions of Austria and left parts of Vienna under water at the weekend, causing severe damage in parts of the country and disrupting road and rail transport, authorities and local media said.
articles.title: Austria battles major flooding after record downpours

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari, Clauda Tanios
articles.description: Acute malnutrition is rapidly increasing in areas of Yemen controlled by the government, with the most critical cases along areas of the Red Sea coast, U.N. food security experts said in a report issued on Sunday.
articles.title: Malnutrition worsening in Yemen's government-controlled areas, UN says

articles.author: Mandy Leong
articles.description: Companies that import palm oil from Malaysia will be able to adopt orangutans but they will not be able to leave the country, the commodities minister said on Sunday, in a revised version of a conservation scheme announced earlier this year.
articles.title: Malaysia announces adopt-an-orangutan plan for palm oil importers
